Load the Bob ROSS dataframe from this link "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fivethirtyeight/data/master/bob-ross/elements-by-episode.csv". It contains list of all bob ross episodes with information about what his painting featured. e.g WINDMILL variable says if the episode paining contained image of a windmill or not.

Inspect it first in the browser to choose correct arguments for the `read.table` command. After loading it, inspect it with `str`, `head` and other commands to make sure you loaded it well. 

**Solution:**

```{r, results='hide'}
df <- read.table("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fivethirtyeight/data/master/bob-ross/elements-by-episode.csv", sep=",", header = T, stringsAsFactors = F)
str(df)
head(df)
```

What are the table dimensions?

a) 1 column and 404 rows
b) **69 columns and 403 rows**
c) 69 columns and 404 rows
d) 403 columns and 69 rows

**Solution:**
```{r}
dim(df)
```

What type of variable is the CABIN column? (choose the BEST possibility, not necessarily what R decided)

a) **logical**
b) data.frame
c) character
d) list

**Solution:**
```{r}
class(df$CABIN)
df$CABIN[1:10]
```

How many percent of episoded featured bushes?

a) 23 %
b) 28 %
c) **30 %**
d) 49 %

**Solution:**
```{r}
sum(df$BUSHES)/nrow(df)
```

which of these episodes didn't feature guest?

a) "PEACEFUL WATERS"
b) **"WINDING STREAM"**
c) "LAKE BY MOUNTAIN"
d) "MOUNTAINS OF GRACE"

**Solution:**
```{r}
df[df$GUEST == 1, "TITLE"]
```

Which of these is the least common feature? You can get it with `colsums` and `sort` function.

a) CLIFF
b) **LAKES**
c) TREE
d) FARM

**Solution:**
```{r}
sort(colSums(df[, 3:69]))[1:10]
```

How many episodes have TREES and take place in WINTER?

a) 0
b) 9
c) 52
d) **64**

**Solution:**
```{r}
sum(df$TREES & df$WINTER)
```

# Correct answers
2, 1, 3, 2, 2, 4
